text: SS Daniel J. Morrell was an American Great Lakes ore carrier. It was 603 feet long. The ship usually carried iron ore. The Morrell sank during a severe storm on November 29, 1966. The ship broke in two before sinking. Twenty-eight of the Morrell's 29 crewmen died during the sinking. Only one crewman survived. ==References== Category:Shipwrecks
title: SS Daniel J. Morrell
